www.abbiproject.eu

An Android application used to control the ABBI bracelet developed by IIT (Italian Institute of Technology). The project will follow the client-server software development paradigm. The server is going to be tied to a central data store and communicate with the Android app via a REST API.
This slider can be used to control the volume of the sound the ABBI bracelet emits.
Use the circular slider to modify the sound frequency (this will result in a change of the sound pitch.)
Select an item from this list to connect to a Bluetooth device.
This field displays the identifier of the ABBI bracelet the device is currently connected to.
This field shows the current state of the ABBI bracelet (connected/disconnected).
This field shows additional data parameters received from the ABBI bracelet.
Battery level is displayed in order to allow users to charge their bracelet whenever the its battery power is running low.
This switch can be used to test the configured sound output from the bracelet.
This switch can be used to mute/ unmute the bracelet whenever users require this.
The bracelet\'s speaker volume output can be controlled from this circular slider.
This option configures the sound output to be continuous.
This option configures the sound output to be intermittent, further settings such as frequency and stream volume can be specified.
Users can choose a sound file from a list of options to be used as the main sound output for the bracelet they are using.
This button displays more properties related to the sound playback mode the user has selected.
Use the circular slider to control the bracelet\'s bpm (beats per minute). Available only for the intermittent sound mode.
Make the sound output configuration for one of the streams reflect the settings for the other.
